intro: Pittosporum resiniferum, commonly known as the resinous pittosporum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces a sticky resin, which has been historically used by Māori for medicinal and ceremonial purposes. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens around the world.
